amendment.description: Amendment redirects funds by $500,000 to support the Secretary of Health and Human Services to conduct a feasibility study on allowing geolocation services with respect to the location of callers to the suicide prevention lifeline referred to in section 520E3 of the Public Health Service Act.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 52 printed in Part B of House Report 116-109 to increase and decrease funds by $500,000 to support the Secretary of Health and Human Services to conduct a feasibility study on allowing geolocation services with respect to the location of callers to the suicide prevention lifeline referred to in section 520E3 of the Public Health Service Act.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Beyer amendment (A050) Agreed to by recorded vote: 359 - 64 (Roll no. 299).

action.text: Amendment agreed to Committee of the Whole
Roll call votes on amendments in House
House amendment agreed to: On agreeing to the Beyer amendment (A050) Agreed to by recorded vote: 359 - 64 (Roll no. 299).
House amendment offered/reported by: Amendment (A050) offered by Mr. Beyer.
